Text.Text: Greetings, <CHARNAME>!  I know we haven't met, but your success against the Chimera Legion has already reached me.  I'm Nathaniel from Kuldahar.

I broke through a portion of the glacier and made my way down a crevasse when I confronted the high priestesses, who overpowered me... as I retreated I realized the hole I made earlier had reformed!  My capture was quick but painful.
Dead... or gone.  What's worse is that between the Aurilite resistance in the foothills and that here, Neverwinter has decided she can't afford to send any more troops to an icy grave.

Yes, three in all - Lysara, Cathin, Oria - sisters, triplets even - conjoined at birth.  They've a strange bond that makes them more powerful when working in concert, and this icy tomb appears to be their creation.
I've yet to solve it, but each dawn a prisoner is taken to the room north of the prison, never to be seen again.  My nightmares are filled with their screams.
Your help would be most welcome, <CHARNAME>.  I need to escape this cell and find the equipment that was taken from me upon my capture.  Until that occurs I'm at the high priestesses' mercy.

The offer is appreciated, but you're in the same predicament as I am - perhaps worse, as you may be a greater threat to the high priestesses.  Gain your own bearing first - then you'll be free to concentrate on *my* woes.
Unfortunately this prison is shrouded by antimagic - I've heard my captors say, "turn east then west to disable," but what does that mean?  My spells are useless under these conditions.

A temple this size is bound to have a treasury or two - my guess would be that's where they've been keeping my equipment, in addition to the items they leave in the snow as donations to their goddess.
South of the prison is a room where captives are prepared for incarceration.  There would be a good start.
When we saw the Aurilites erecting a wall of ice, I was sent here to destroy it.  But my plan failed, and now this wall has blossomed into a glacier!
The presence of these Aurilites is a bad omen indeed.  Unfortunately, I'm powerless without my freedom.

The time to share the fate of my fellow captives had finally arrived, and as the Aurilites lead me into the next room, I felt a surge of nature's faith wash over me - it was just enough to ensure my escape, but at what cost?
Welcome back.  Have you made any progress?
Welcome back.  Have you made any progress?
Most unnatural elements exist here.  The wind is colder - the snow thicker - for this season.  The ice itself, once broken, reforms over time.

We *must* defeat the High Priestesses Lysara, Cathin, and Oria, as well as destroy their altar - their conduit into Auril's world of unforgiving chill, but I can't do this alone.  Friend, can your aid reach further?

All that's left is to remove this glacier and its temple in one fell swoop.  Even though no more reinforcements may be arriving from Neverwinter or Luskan, the Ten-Towns will still need to rely on trade routes through the Western Pass.
Thank you, <CHARNAME> - I feared I would be locked up in that cell forever!
Until we meet again, my friend, may nature guide and protect you.
I had a special Ring of the Ram in my possession to destroy the glacier with, but its current whereabouts are unknown to me.  Nevertheless, my spells should suffice.

You've honored your reputation ten-fold, I must say!  Once I've destroyed a portion of the glacier, please use the created fissure to head south around the Spine of the World Mountains on foot, and take the unguarded Eastern Pass to Kuldahar.  Oswald's airship is needed to evacuate Kuldahar's citizens.

I'd heard about his crash.  I've known Oswald since I was a child - "Little Nate," he'd call me, even after I outgrew him.  Thankfully you've survived.  If he cast his mending spell again, I'll need to expedite it with a few of my own.
I'd love to, but I fear there's little I can do from within a locked prison cell.
Warn them about the collusion between the Aurilites and the Legion of the Chimera.  I'll check on Oswald and we'll fly to Targos and the other Ten-Towns to warn them, then meet you in Kuldahar.
These Aurilites *must* be the root of this sinister weather, but how?  Why?  Without knowing more, there is nothing I can do.  I could use your help.
That's excellent news, <CHARNAME>...!  However, I fear the chill in the air remains still... could there be another altar?

<CHARNAME>, the bards will sing of this day!  Normally this tale would be over, but with Auril, others will heed her call, so we *must* sever the link the goddess has with this world by destroying her altar.
Ahhh... how could I not have sensed the agent of Talos?!  Good work, <CHARNAME>, but now you must deal them a fatal blow.
Freedom at last!  I *knew* my faith in you would let us prevail.
That is wondrous news indeed, <CHARNAME>!  To think... you took on a glacier and won!  That will not soon be forgotten, I think!
My bag of holding!  Excellent, thank you, <CHARNAME>.  It has a rather tricky arcane knot sealing it - I was afraid the Aurilites might try to hack it open, and, well, never mind.
That is ill news, indeed - never have I seen desecration on a scale as vast as this.
High priestesses?
Where's the rest of the Neverwinter militia?  We were to meet with them.
You say the ice reformed itself?
How did you get here again?
How did you get here?
They're gone?
They're gone?
You say the ice reformed itself?
Have you any idea how this glacier can be destroyed?
Where's the rest of the Neverwinter militia?  We were to meet with them.
Where's the rest of the Neverwinter militia?  We were to meet with them.
Where did you say the Neverwinter militia was?
How did you get here?
How did you get here again?
Do you know why magic doesn't work in the prison?
Tell me again why magic doesn't work in the prison.
We've unlocked your cell door.  You're free now.
We found the key to your cell.  You're free now.
Your guess was correct.  Your equipment was stored in the temple's treasury.
We found this bag in the temple's treasury.  I believe it's yours.
High priestesses?
We'll find a way to free you.  Farewell for now.
We'll find your equipment.  Farewell for now.
I must depart now.  Farewell.
High priestesses?
How did you get here again?
How did you get here?
You say the ice reformed itself?
Have you any idea how this glacier can be destroyed?
Have you any idea where they might have taken our equipment?
Once we're free we'll find a way to free you also.  Farewell for now.
I'll do that.  Farewell.
How did you get here again?
How did you get here?
You say the ice reformed itself?
Have you any idea how this glacier can be destroyed?
Where are your items again?
Where are your items?
Have you any idea where they might have taken our equipment?
Your guess was correct.  Your equipment was stored in the temple's treasury.
We found this bag in the temple's treasury.  I believe it's yours.
How did you get here again?
How did you get here?
You say the ice reformed itself?
Have you any idea how this glacier can be destroyed?
We'll find your equipment.  Farewell for now.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
How did you get here again?
How did you get here?
You say the ice reformed itself?
Have you any idea how this glacier can be destroyed?
Where's the rest of the Neverwinter militia?  We were to meet with them.
Were there any other prisoners?
Do you know why magic doesn't work in the prison?
We'll look for your equipment when we find ours.  Farewell for now.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
Brother, has nature abandoned you?
Brother, has nature abandoned you?
What happened?
What happened?
Where's the rest of the Neverwinter militia?  We were to meet with them.
Were there any other prisoners?
Do you know why magic doesn't work in the prison?
Can we help?
Can we help?
Have you any idea where they might have taken our equipment?
We've unlocked your cell door.  You're free now.
We found the key to your cell.  You're free now.
We'll find a way to free you.  Farewell for now.
Well met.
We've unlocked your cell door.  You're free now.
We found the key to your cell door.  You're free now.
Your guess was correct.  Your equipment was stored in the temple's treasury.
We found this bag in the temple's treasury.  I believe it's yours.
We spoke to High Priestess Lysara.  She boasted that they've been maintaining the glacier by sacrificing prisoners to her goddess Auril.
We read High Priestess Lysara's journal.  It says she's been maintaining the glacier by sacrificing prisoners to her goddess Auril.
We haven't defeated all three high priestesses yet, but Zack Boosenburry helped us desecrate the altar they were using in their ritual.
We defeated all three high priestesses, and Zack Boosenburry helped us desecrate the altar they were using in their ritual.
We defeated all three high priestesses, but haven't destroyed the altar used in their ritual.
We haven't defeated all three high priestesses yet, but we destroyed the tempest's spirit who was maintaining the glacier.
We defeated all three high priestesses and destroyed the tempest's spirit who was maintaining the glacier.
Tell me how you were captured again.
Tell me how you were captured again.
Why were you imprisoned?
Why were you imprisoned?
Where did you say your equipment might be stored?
Where did you say your equipment might be stored?
Have you any idea where they might have taken your equipment?
Have you any idea where they might have taken your equipment?
Have you any idea where they might have taken our equipment?
Do you know what's going on here?
How can we stop these Aurilites?
Where did you say the Neverwinter militia was?
Where's the rest of the Neverwinter militia?  We were to meet with them.
What did you say happened to the other prisoners?
Were there any other prisoners?
Tell me again why magic doesn't work in the prison.
Do you know why magic doesn't work in the prison?
Now that we've removed the anti-magic field in the prison, can you heal me?
Can you watch over us while we take a moment to regain our strength?
Can you watch over us while we rest until our wounds have healed?
Can you watch over us while we take a moment to regain our strength?
Can you watch over us while we rest until our wounds have healed?
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
We've unlocked your cell door.  You're free now.
We found the key to your cell door.  You're free now.

Nothing new.  Farewell.
We haven't defeated all three high priestesses yet, but Zack Boosenburry helped us desecrate the altar they were using in their ritual.
We defeated all three high priestesses, and Zack Boosenburry helped us desecrate the altar they were using in their ritual.
We defeated all three high priestesses, but haven't destroyed the altar used in their ritual.
We haven't defeated all three high priestesses yet, but we destroyed the tempest's spirit who was maintaining the glacier.
We defeated all three high priestesses and destroyed the tempest's spirit who was maintaining the glacier.
Yes, we'll return when we've dealt with all of them.  Farewell for now.
Go on.
Anything else we can do?
What else troubles you?
What's next?
What happens now?
Where do we go from here?
I believe this ring we found in a private treasure vault is yours.  Good luck and farewell.
Ring?  Hmmm... sorry, no - haven't seen it.  Well, ahhh, good luck and farewell.
Good luck and farewell.
We've unlocked your cell door.  You're free now.
We found the key to your cell.  You're free now.
We'll find a way to free you.  Farewell for now.
I must depart now.  Farewell.
I'd forgotten about Oswald.  Here, take these components we've collected for his Mending Spell - his ship is badly damaged.
I'd forgotten about Oswald.  Here, take these items we've collected - perhaps they can be used to repair his badly damaged ship.
Oswald... he was stuck in a trance when we crashed in the foothills.  We nearly lost our voices waking him.
Oswald... he was stuck in a trance when we crashed in the foothills.  The noise we made afterwards woke him.
We spoke to High Priestess Lysara.  She boasted that they've been maintaining the glacier by sacrificing prisoners to her goddess Auril.
We read High Priestess Lysara's journal.  It says she's been maintaining the glacier by sacrificing prisoners to her goddess Auril.
We'll find what information we can and return.  Farewell for now.
We'll investigate further.  Farewell.
We'll do our best.  Farewell.
Consider it done.  Farewell.
Anything else we can do?
